subject: Re: [PATCH v2 1/1] mm: numa_memblks: Identify the accurate NUMA ID of CFMW

reviews.author: Cui Chao (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Cui Chao, is the author of the patch and provides additional context to clarify their previous statements about the issue being discovered on QEMU and not hardware.

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jonathan Cameron raised concerns about the patch's description of a potential hardware configuration issue, but after clarification from the submitter, he found the code changes to be acceptable.

reviews.author: Andrew Morton
reviews.summary: Andrew Morton asked for clarification on the userspace-visible runtime effects of incorrect NUMA ID assignment, suggested adding a Fixes: tag to the changelog, and recommended doing a v3 patch with updated changelog in the next -rc cycle.

reviews.author: Pratyush Brahma
reviews.summary: Reviewer Pratyush Brahma suggested a change to the comment in phys_to_target_node function to better reflect its new logic of preferring numa_meminfo unless the address is also described by reserved ranges.

reviews.author: dan.j.williams
reviews.summary: The reviewer, dan.j.williams, is requesting more information about the shipping hardware platforms that create physical address maps like the one described in the patch. They are questioning whether Linux should fix this issue and suggesting that platform firmware might be able to resolve it.

reviews.author: Gregory Price
reviews.summary: Reviewer Gregory Price raised concerns that the patch implies CXL memory regions are not shipping SRAT tables, which might be correctable in firmware or a QEMU issue.

reviews.author: Jonathan development
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Jonathan Cameron, disagrees with the patch's approach and suggests that providing SRAT Memory Affinity Structures for CEDT CXL Fixed Memory Window Structures (CFMWSs) should be done only if the BIOS has also programmed the full set of decoders. He advises against relying on heuristics in the BIOS and instead recommends OS control.
